content.prompt: Prattâ€™s arguments in the excerpt in support of his school for American Indians had most in common with the arguments of which of the following groups?

choices.label: Business leaders in the later 1800s who maintained that laissez-faire policies would best encourage economic growth
Some social reformers in the later 1800s who founded settlement houses for newly arrived immigrants
African American activists in the early 1900s who advocated for separation from White society
Anti-imperialists in the early 1900s who opposed United States governance of non-White peoples overseas

topic.text: 6.9: Responses to Immigration in the Gilded Age

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
